plants.name: Nerium oleander
plants.description: A hardy evergreen shrub or small tree common in Mediterranean and subtropical regions, known for its prolific clusters of fragrant flowers that bloom year-round in mild climates.
plants.bloomingSeason: May to December (year-round in frost-free areas)
plants.location: Mediterranean Basin, Southern US, parts of Australia
plants.funFact: Oleander is highly toxic if ingested, but its beautiful colorful flowers make it a popular ornamental plant in warmer climates.

plants.name: Helleborus niger
plants.description: A perennial plant native to mountainous regions of Europe, famous for blooming in winter, often around Christmas, with striking white flowers that brighten the cold months.
plants.funFact: Despite the common name, the Christmas Rose is not a true rose and can bloom through snow, symbolizing hope in winter.

plants.name: Camellia japonica
plants.description: An evergreen shrub or small tree with glossy leaves and large, showy flowers that bloom from late fall through early spring, widely cultivated in temperate and subtropical gardens.
plants.location: Japan, Korea, China; widely cultivated worldwide
plants.funFact: Camellias were highly prized in ancient China and Japan, often featured in traditional art and tea ceremonies.

plants.name: Posidonia oceanica
plants.description: An underwater seagrass species native to the Mediterranean Sea, not a flowering plant in the traditional sense but produces flowers underwater during late autumn to early winter.
plants.funFact: Neptune Grass is crucial for marine ecosystems, providing habitat and oxygen, and its underwater flowers are pollinated by water currents.
